reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Kuyaba Dec 4, 2011 and really like it! We stayed in a deluxe room (#14) and were impressed with the cleanliness and the quaint decor and lovely atmosphere of Kuyaba. We had dinner and breakfast at the Kuyaba restaurant and the food was excellent!!! The food was Jamaican and authentic and very well prepared. We did not spend any time on the beach, but we did dine ocean front at dinner and at breakfast and found the beach to be so very beautiful, but small. The servers at the restaurant provided the best service and were very attentive but not overly so. We only stayed there one night because our regular resort was overbooked for one night, but we are so glad to find Kuyaba and we will be back. It is a great alternative to the larger all-inclusive resorts in Jamaica, and the price is right! Thanks Zelma and all the other wonderful staff at Kuyaba!!
reviews.title: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay!

reviews.text: We typically try to stay at Kuyaba when we go visit Negril. Clean rooms, cold AC, great restaurant and bar, all right on the beach. Music from Burboun Beach next door can be loud at times unless you face north. Ask for a fridge in your room and pick up some of your own beer and Dark and Stormys!
reviews.title: Another great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I went to Kuyaba by accident--we were booked at another hotel and there was some mix-up, so they sent us to Kuyaba. Definitely one of the best mistakes to happen to me! Kuyaba is impeccably kept--the grounds are beautiful, with native trees, flowers, lush landscaping, and two hilarious pet birds that chat and shake hands. The rooms are really nice--they have individual patios with hammocks, and a huge bathroom with an open shower and a deep Jacuzzi tub. The water is entirely drinkable, gets and stays hot, and the air conditioning in the bedrooms keeps it cool all night. The staff are some of the sweetest people I've met; like other reviewers, I was increasingly impressed by the concierge, Zelma, and the bartenders, waiters, security guards, and housekeeping. They remembered our names and plans, had nice chats with us, and generally made us feel like we belonged there.
reviews.title: Perfect low-key vacation spot

reviews.text: The restaurant backs directly onto the beach, which is small but perfectly serviceable for swimming, sunbathing, and meditating with a great view. Some of the best memories of my vacation are sitting at the restaurant, sipping a cocktail and staring out over the water. The food is great, and the longer you spend in Negril, the more you'll come to appreciate Kuyaba's quality. They have a great mix of Jamaican staples, but done in a way that is higher-end and more approachable for visitors. And the coconut pie with rum sauce is amazing.
reviews.title: Relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk, Zelma and Reggie, are more than happy to recommend trips and tour companies, and even set them up for you if you're not sure how to go about it. They'll let you know the best drivers to hire, the right restaurants to go to, and even how much to expect to pay for a taxi or to tip someone. Kuyaba has a glass-bottom boat on staff that can take you out to the reef for some great snorkeling, or cruise the coast at sunset. The guides on the boat were friendly and made us feel safe.
reviews.title: Great place very nice rooms

reviews.text: This is not a fancy place, but it's GREAT for the money you spend. The queen rooms were very nice - clean, and the mattresses are hard as a rock which I LOVE. Best sleep I've gotten in a while! Zelma let us in to see the King rooms and they were gorgeous, beautiful bathrooms, nice finishes. The rustic cabins are RUSTIC - do not get these rooms if you are picky. They are great because there's a porch outside to hang out on, but they are definitely not in the greatest condition. However, for a group of young friends (we're all in our 30's) just to basically have a place to sleep, you can't beat that price!
reviews.title: Great location, great stay for the money!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food at the restaurant was excellent - we ate breakfast there almost every day, and one dinner. They (like every restaurant in Jamaica) are in no hurry so don't go starving.
reviews.title: Lovely restful holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate a lot of the beef patties from the guy that sits across the street - cheap and AWESOME. We also ate a lot of jerk chicken from the other guy across the street - seriously you could live on this food for a week for probably 25 bucks.
reviews.title: Incredible staff and great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach was very nice and kept clean by the staff, but small. We were there in low season (early December) so there weren't that many people - but I would imagine that there would be space issues if there were more people there.
reviews.title: Out dated, ramshackle hotel that nickel and dimes you and has terrible service - don't go here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The vendors on the beach don't bother me... if you politely but firmly tell them no thank you, they'll go away. If you appear undecided or give them only a half-no (trying to be nice), they will bug you. And others will come over also once one has gotten your attention - so just be firm but nice. These guys are just trying to make a living and most of them are very nice.
reviews.title: Overpriced with Poor Service

reviews.text: it was my first stop in negril and i made a big mistake .no service,no kettle in bed room even their blanket was not clean ,because i found it with blood .room smelled funny .save your money !!!!!!!!!!!!don't go !!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: terrible trip!

reviews.text: What a lovely hotel with great staff. The rustic cabins were just that- but also just fine. Who needs TV in Jamaica? We had an issue with our door lock and they came immediately and fixed it. Can't say enough about Zelma and all the staff- especially the security guys. I would definately stay here again.
reviews.title: Kuyaba is wonderful
Worst place I have ever stayed.
reviews.text: Booked two weeks there with high hopes. The mattress's were on cement bases, might as well have slept on the cement. The bathrooms were dark and danky. The manager at the time was soooo rude to our Jamaican friends during our stay, she even asked them to leave half an hour before the 10pm cut off time for guests. She treated us so bad we complained to Mark who is one of the owners, they are brothers. She tried to over shadow our conversation with him by saying "I'm only trying to do my job Mr. Mark, Mr. Mark". Well if being rude and obnoxious to her own native people in front of guests is doing her job I dodn't want to stay there. He willing let both of us out of our 2 week commitment and we moved down to Sheilds of Negril where they offered us a better price, a clean bright room and excellent service. We have stayed there several times and they have always been super nice and polite. Would never stay at Kuyaba again, it was a very poor show to new guests who have been coming to Negril since the '80"s.

We recently returned from a trip to both Montego Bay and Negril. A friend had recommended Kuyaba and so we booked it based completely on this recommendation. After Montego Bay we found Negril's beach to be far superior. The 7 Mile Beach is quite stunning with the perfect Caribbean water. Kuyaba was a real find in many ways - but not without it's issues. The rooms were good - very adequate, clean, and comfortable for the money. The facility is very cool - very rustic, jungly and great setting - right on the beach. The restaurant and bar has an amazing setting and feel about it, but, contrary to all the other reviews we read here, we found the food pretty terrible. The breakfast was pretty good - but we ate here for dinner a few nights and nothing that any of us had was at all good. Even the simple pasta dish was pretty terrible. Worse than that, though, was the service. The only person that seemed to care at all about us was Kevin, the guard on the beach. He was the best! And Yes, there is a guard 24/7 on the beach (and at the front of the property from the road) - to help keep the "solicitors" at bay and off the property. When going to Negril one has to be prepared for this. The people trying to sell you everything from a large variety of drugs, hair-braiding, crafts, massages, etc is non-stop. I will say, it never felt threatening or dangerous, but definitely annoying after awhile. Also, the smell of marijuana is very pervasive. At all hours of the day and night. I don't care that much if people are smoking pot around me, but it's a bit much when we are going down to breakfast at 8am and the smell of pot is everywhere! And it continues throughout the day. If that's your thing, though - you will love Negril!
reviews.title: Great authentic rustic facilities, but sketchy area. Best on the beach.

reviews.text: Bottom line - Kuyaba seemed to be the best place on the beach - and has a very cool, authentic, rustic vibe about it - but you have to be prepared to figure things out on your own (they were not at all helpful in recommending a place to dine, or to find an ATM, etc) If you know what you are getting into - and are ok dealing with all the vendors on the beach - it is a pretty unique and special place.
reviews.title: Kuyaba

reviews.text: My husband and I recently got married at Kuyaba and we couldn't have been happier! We stayed in the honeymoon suite for 2 weeks and it was roomy, comfortable and very romantic. Up on the second level with large windows and beautiful french doors out to the large balcony it was bright and beautiful. My parents stayed in the suite below us and they loved it as well. My friend stayed in one of the rustic cabin rooms and she said that is was very rustic but got what she expected for the price.
reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing

reviews.text: And our wedding there was absolutely beautiful! Zelma was amazing, organizing the marriage license, minister, flowers, walkway and arch decorations, dinner table and everyone's meals. We could not have done it without her and we couldn't have been more pleased with the evening (minus the rain right before the ceremony!).
reviews.title: wow...more than expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate a lot of our meals at the restaurant there, mainly due to the fact that it's one of the best places to eat on the beach. After having a few disappointing breakfasts elsewhere we ended up eating breakfast at Kuyaba everyday and had quite a few lunches and dinners there as well and we never had a bad meal there. Service is some of the best on the beach as well! If you've been to Jamaica before you know to expect slow service and even though service at Kuyaba is not up to North American standards it was still quicker than most places we ate at.
reviews.title: Awesome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Many of our wedding guests stayed elsewhere in Negril like Country Country, Sunset at the Palms and Couples and I believe that we had the best hotel for the value. All of the above mentioned hotels are a lot more expensive than Kuyaba and although we only saw Country Country (the other two are exclusive resorts), I think Kuyaba was just a nice. The grounds are beautifully maintained, the rooms bright and comfortable, and the staff very friendly. I would highly recommend Kuyaba to everyone, and we will be going back there for sure!
reviews.title: We loved Kuyaba!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My stay in Negril began a bit rocky considering my move from another hotel after one night and a run in with an illegal taxi , but as soon as I reached Kuyaba it was total relaxation. The Management were very understanding since I checked in early and they made me feel right at home. The food was wonderful and the drinks delicious. Thanks to Ricky my bartender for making sure I had my Red Strip to go and taking good care of me. The room was very clean, smelt clean and the bathroom was a good size. The little porch off the room with the swing seat was my favorite part. Just chillin and relaxin to the sound of waves and birds. One of my best vacations ever!
reviews.title: Best on the beach
